results.title: Rushmore [DVD]
results.creator_credit: American Empirical Pictures, Barry Mendel, Paul Schiff and Wes Anderson
results.brief_description: Max Fisher (Jason Schwartzman) is a highly eccentric 10th grade student at Rushmore Academy whose life is altered when he meets and falls in love with the elegant Miss Cross (Olivia Williams), a recently widowed first grade teacher. Max finds himself caught in a strange love triangle when his close friend Mr. Blume (Bill Murray), a wealthy steel tycoon also falls for Miss Cross. Written by Wes Anderson and Owen Wilson, this films addresses the intricate relationships that evolve between students, teachers, friends and family.

results.title: Rushmore
results.creator_credit: American Empirical Pictures, Touchstone Pictures, Barry Mendel, Paul Schiff and Wes Anderson
results.brief_description: Max Fisher (Jason Schwartzman) is a highly eccentric 10th grade student at Rushmore Academy whose life is altered when he meets and falls in love with the elegant Miss Cross (Olivia Williams), a recently widowed first grade teacher. Max finds himself caught in a strange love triangle when his close friend Mr. Blume (Bill Murray), a wealthy steel tycoon also falls for Miss Cross. Written by Wes Anderson and Owen Wilson, this films addresses the intricate relationships that evolve between students, teachers, friends and family. Cast also includes Seymour Cassel. Brian Cox.

results.title: Running on empty
results.creator_credit: Lorimar Film Entertainment, Amy Robinson, Griffin Dunne and Sidney Lumet
results.brief_description: An absorbing film about a pair of anti-Vietnam activists (Judd Hirsch and Christine Lahti) who have been in hiding from the FBI for over fifteen years. Still committed to their radical ideals, the couple have to face a crisis of conscience when their talented oldest son (River Phoenix) begins to dream about attending music college and leaving behind his life on the run. This under-rated film is an extremely clear-headed portrayal of how the the politics of the Vietnam era still affects the social relationships of contemporary America. One of the most remarkable features of this film is the compassionate tone it extends across the generations. This complex and intelligent film is a film that refuses the easy revisionist moralism of Kasdan’s “The Big Chill”. Made in a decade notable for computer generated whimsy, this very adult Hollywood film is a treasure.

results.title: Runaway bride
results.creator_credit: Interscope Commmunication, Lakeshore Entertainment, Touchstone Pictures, Robert W. Cort, Ted Field, Scott Kroopf, Tom Rosenberg and Garry Marshall
results.brief_description: Richard Gere is Ike Graham, a big-city newspaper columnist who causes an uproar with an unflattering and wildly erroneous story about small-town girl Maggie Carpenter. Julia Roberts is Maggie, whose reputation for leaving prospective husbands at the altar has made her a local legend. Gere is assigned by his editor (Hector Elizondo) to write a follow-up story on Maggie, and he tracks her down to her home town in Maryland where she is spending time with her family and preparing to give marriage another try. While Ike plans to prove he was right about Maggie, and Maggie plans to even the score with Ike, nothing prepares them for the sparks that fly when they meet! Cast also includes Joan Cusack, Rita Wilson, Paul Dooley, Christopher Meloni.

results.title: Run Lola run = Lola Rennt [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Arte, BMI, Bavaria Film, FFA - Filmforderungsanstalt, FilmFernsehFonds Bayern, German Independents, NRW, WDR, X filme creative Pool, Stefan Arndt and Tom Tykwer
results.brief_description: Time is running out for Lola (Franka Potente). She’s just received a frantic phone call from her boyfriend Manni (Moritz Bleibtreu), who’s lost a small fortune in cash belonging to his Mob boss. Now she has to run for his life, to try and come up with the money before Manni pays the ultimate price for his mistake. Using a destiny device, the story begins anew with different outcomes. Other cinematic techniques which add to the breakneck pace and excitement of this innovative thriller include jump cuts, whip pans, slow and fast motion, split-screen, intercut colour and black and white, segment titles and animation.

results.title: Rumble Fish
results.creator_credit: Zoetrope Studios, Fred Roos, Doug Claybourne and Francis Ford Coppola
results.brief_description: Academy Award winning director Francis Ford Coppola’s visually stunning adaptation of the S.E. Hinton novel. Starring teen heart-throbs Matt Dillon and Mickey Rourke as two brothers whose desire to break out of their urban trap eventually leads to death for one and a new beginning for the other. Photographed in black and white with colour sequences, this striking production features a brilliant supporting cast including Dennis Hopper and boasts a musical score by Stewart Copeland.

results.title: Rugrats in Paris: the movie = Rugrats II
results.creator_credit: MFP Munich Film Partners GmbH, GmbH and Co, Rugrats Production KG, Arlene Klasky, Gabor Csupo, Paul Demeyer and Stig Bergqvist
results.brief_description: When Angelica catches a few scenes from the “The Godfather” on television, she takes it upon herself to become the Bubfather and grants wishes to her fellow Rugrats. Chuckie’s wish is to have a new mother. Not long after, Stu Pickles receives an emergency call to travel to Europetarland, France, to repair a faulty Raptor and pacify rampaging theme park director, Coco LaBouche. He’s invited to bring family and friends for company and the Rugrats find themselves in Paris. In an effort to gain a promotion and become company president, the child hating Coco makes a play for Chuckie’s hapless father Chas in a desperate attempt to win favour with the outgoing President. Only Angelica knows of Coco’s cunning plan and it’s up to the Rugrats to save Chas, imperilling a few famous landmarks along the way. Humorous throughout, the film has a strong sense of familial values and what constitutes “good” parenting. Features the voices of Susan Sarandon, John Lithgow, Debbie Reynolds, Christine Cavanaugh, Elizabeth Daily and Cheryl Chase.

results.title: Royal Wedding
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Arthur Freed and Stanley Donen
results.brief_description: Fred Astaire delivers a magnificent series of dancing performances in this outstanding musical which also stars Jane Powell, Sarah Churchill, Peter Lawford and Keenan Wynn. Fred Astaire plays the role of a journalist sent to cover the Royal Wedding in London. This is the film which used the revolutionary photographic techniques which allowed Fred Astaire to do his famous “dancing on the ceiling”. Rated: G

results.title: Roxanne
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Michael Rachmil, Daniel Melnick and Fred Schepisi
results.brief_description: A modern version of the Cyranno De Bergerac story starring Steve Martin and Daryl Hannah, directed by Fred Schepisi. Small town fire chief C.D. Bales falls in love with a new arrival to the town; an astronomer called Roxanne. He possesses a large nose which stands in the way of his attaining happiness, but eventually true love triumphs in this heartwarming tale.

results.title: Roustabout
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Hal B Wallis and John Rich
results.brief_description: The year is 1964, and the mini-skirt is in. Charlie Rogers is a coffee-house singer who joins a financially troubled carnival. He is hired by owner, Maggie Morgan, and soon catches the eye of his pretty female co-worker, Cathy Lean. Cathy’s irate father, Joe, clashes with Charlie when he tries to romance his daughter, but Charlie’s singing and looks helps bring in the much-needed money for the near-bankrupt carnival. Cast includes Elvis Presley, Barbara Stanwyck, Joan Freeman and Leif Erickson.
